undulate:
波动，起伏 
to move or be shaped like waves
dubious:
可疑的 
causing doubt, uncertainty, or suspicion
afoot:
在进行中的 
developing or happening now; in progress
skim:
浏览 
to look over or read (something) quickly especially to find the main ideas

撇去 
to remove a layer of something from the surface of a liquid
contextual:
取决于上下文的 
relating to the context of something.
condescend:
屈尊 
to do something that you usually do not do because you believe you are too important to do it
bygone:
很久以前的 
gone by; from a time in the past
incessant:
不断的 
continuing without stopping; not stopping
cripple:
使残疾，使成为跛子 
to cause (a person or animal) to be unable to move or walk normally

严重削弱 
to make (something) unable to work normally
causality:
因果关系 
the relationship between something that happens or exists and the thing that causes it 
202
lineage:
家族，家系 
the people who were in someone's family in past times

子孙后代 
a group of individuals tracing descent from a common ancestor
impartial:
公正的 
treating all people and groups equally; not partial or biased
infertile:
人 不能生育的， 动物 不能繁殖的 
not able to reproduce; not able to produce children, young animals, etc.

贫瘠的 
not suited for raising crops; unable to support the growth of plants 
203
fret:
烦恼 
a state of being worried or upset

感到烦恼 
to worry or be concerned
asylum:
庇护 
protection given by a government to someone who has left another country in order to 
escape being harmed
unremitting:
不停的，不减的 
not stopping or growing weaker
downfall:
垮台，衰败 
a sudden loss of power, happiness, success, etc.
intrigue:
激起…兴趣 
to make (someone) want to know more about something; to cause (someone) to become interested
derail:
使脱轨 
to leave its tracks
superficiality:
肤浅 
the quality or state of being superficial
dire:
可怕的 
warning of disaster; showing a very bad future
marginal:
边缘的 
not included in the main part of society or of a group

微小的 
very slight or small
guardian:
监护人 
someone who takes care of another person or of another person's property
exuberant:
繁茂的 
existing in large amounts; very plentiful

情感等丰富的 
very lively, happy, or energetic; filled with energy and enthusiasm 
204
entice:
诱使 
to attract (someone) especially by offering or showing something that is appealing, 
interesting, etc.
veto:
否决 
a decision by a person in authority to not allow or approve something (such as a new law)
latitude:
自由度 
freedom to choose how to act or what to do

纬度 
an imaginary line that circles the earth at a particular latitude and that is parallel to the equator
surmount:
战胜 
to deal with (a problem or a difficult situation) successfully
whither:
哪里；何处；到何处 
where; to which
blaze:
燃烧 
to burn very brightly and intensely

照耀 
to shine very brightly
sniff:
嗅 
to smell (something or someone) by putting your nose close to it and taking air in through 
your nose in short breaths

以鼻吸气，抽鼻子 
to take air into your nose in short breaths that are loud enough to be heard
paralyze:
使瘫痪 
to make (a person or animal) unable to move or feel all or part of the body

使无能为力 
to make (someone or something) unable to function, act, or move
hoard:
积累，聚集 
to collect and hide a large amount of (something valuable)
outbid:
在拍卖等中出价较高；出价高于… 
to offer more money than somebody else in order to buy something, for example at an auction
apprise:
告知，通知 
to give information to (someone) 
205
proliferation:
激增；涌现；增殖；大量的事物 
the sudden increase in the number or amount of something; a large number of a particular thing
listless:
无精打采的 
lacking energy or spirit
insular:
岛的 
of, relating to, or constituting an island

孤立的；保守的，思想狭隘的 
separated from other people or cultures; not knowing or interested in new or different ideas
commodity:
商品，货物 
something that is bought and sold

有用的东西 
a useful quality or thing
ludicrous:
荒唐可笑的 
very foolish; ridiculous
flank:
建筑物、山等的侧面 
the side of something such as a building or mountain

军队或运动队的翼侧，侧面，侧翼 
the left or right side of an army during a battle, or a sports team during a game

位于…的侧翼；在…侧面 
to be placed on one or both sides of something
granite:
花岗岩 
a very hard type of rock that is used in buildings and monuments
stamina:
持久力，耐力，毅力 
great physical or mental strength that allows you to continue doing something for a long time
forbear:
忍耐 
to hold oneself back from especially with an effort
egocentric:
以自我为中心的；自私自利的 
caring too much about yourself and not about other people
tycoon:
企业界大亨，巨头 
a very wealthy and powerful business person
luxurious:
奢侈的，华丽的 
very comfortable and expensive 
206
outstep:
超过，超出，走过头 
to step or go beyond; to exceed
hurdle:
困难，障碍物 
something that makes an achievement difficult

跨栏 
to jump over (something) while running
tweak:
拧 
to pinch and pull (something) with a sudden movement

稍微改进 
to change (something) slightly in order to improve it
earthly:
尘世的，世间的 
having to do with life on the earth
inference:
推断 
the act or process of reaching a conclusion about something from known facts or evidence
resurgent:
复苏的 
becoming popular, active, or successful again after a period of being less popular, active, or successful
meager:
不足的，贫乏的，粗劣的 
deficient in amount or quality or extent
hoax:
欺骗 
to trick or deceive (someone)
assail:
攻击 
to attack or criticize (someone or something) in a violent or angry way
ruthless:
无情的 
having no pity; cruel or merciless
crumple:
压皱； 使 变皱； 使 起皱 
to crush something into folds; to become crushed into folds

因受伤、失去知觉、喝醉而瘫倒 
to fall down in an uncontrolled way because you are injured, unconscious, drunk, etc. 
207
interpose:
插入，插进 问题或话语 
to add a question or remark into a conversation

将…置于 二者之间；插入；夹进 
to place something between two people or things
skeptic:
怀疑论者 
a person who questions or doubts something (such as a claim or statement)
fervor:
热心，热情 
a strong feeling of excitement and enthusiasm
devastate:
彻底破坏；摧毁；毁灭 
to completely destroy a place or an area

使震惊；使极为忧伤；使极为悲痛 
to make somebody feel very shocked and sad
dichotomy:
二分法，截然对立 
a difference between two opposite things; a division into two opposite groups
contour:
轮廓 
the outline or outer edge of something

画轮廓 
to shape the contour of
pathology:
病理学 
the study of diseases and of the changes that they cause
decipher:
破译 
to find the meaning of (something that is difficult to read or understand)
brethren:
称呼教友或男修会等的成员弟兄 
used to talk to people in church or to talk about the members of a male religious group

同一组织等的成员；同道；同仁 
people who are part of the same society as yourself
incongruous:
不和谐的 
strange because of not agreeing with what is usual or expected
tease:
取笑，戏弄 
to laugh at and criticize (someone) in a way that is either friendly and playful or cruel and unkind

梳理毛发

clog:
阻塞

阻碍，阻塞

sinuous:
蜿蜒的，弯弯曲曲的

摇曳生姿的，动作柔软的 
turning while moving, in a graceful way
utterly:
完全地，彻底地 
completely and without qualification; absolutely completely
exodus:
大批的离去 
a situation in which many people leave a place at the same time
almanac:
年鉴

历书；年历 
a book that gives information about the sun, moon, times of the tides(= the rise and fall of

invigorate:
使活跃 
to give life and energy to (someone)

鼓舞 
to cause (something) to become more active and lively
ethnicity:
种族身份，种族特点，种族渊源 
a particular ethnic affiliation or group
disparage:
贬低 
to belittle the importance or value of (someone or something) ;to lower (someone or

auspicious:
吉利的 
showing or suggesting that future success is likely
audacious:
大胆的，冒失的 
very confident and daring; very bold and surprising or shocking

mercenary:

唯利是图的，贪财的
